body.p: Users with a role of organization Owner or Admin have access to a Usage Statistics page where they can see various statistics for all of the site configurations attached to the current organization.
The top chart displays statistics in a graph form according to the selected metric and filtering options.

You can click the up or down arrow to the right of the title for each column header to sort that particular column. If you click the name of the site configuration, you will be directed to that particular site configuration. By default, the table is sorted in the descending order of the number of page views from the last column of the table (last month or last day of the selected period). You can click the arrow to the left of the site configuration name in the first column to expand the particular site configuration to show its configured versions. By default, the versions are sorted chronologically in this table.
At the top of the usage statistics page, there are some filtering options for the graphs:

dd.p: You can choose which site configurations to have their statistics displayed.

body.p: The second chart displays the same statistics but in numerical format.

The AI Assistant Threads and AI Assistant Search Summaries metrics also include a table with additional statistics below the numerical chart. The additional statistics shown are as follows:
AI Assistant Threads - The table includes columns that show the site name, number of AI Assistant threads, the average number of replies generated by the AI, the average number of user replies, the number of AI threads that encountered an error, the estimated number of tokens consumed across all AI threads, and the average number of tokens consumed by the AI Assistant per thread.
AI Assistant Search Summaries - The table includes columns that show the site name, the total number of AI search summaries generated, the number of successful responses, the number of search summaries where the continue in chat feature was used, and the estimated number of tokens consumed by AI search summaries.

p.note: For the AI Assistant Threads and AI Assistant Search Summaries metrics, the table includes a column that shows the average number of tokens consumed by the AI Assistant per thread/summary.
